chapter.title: Module (Counterparty)
chapter.para: The enhances the level of communication between the different actors of international trade operations.

section.title: Overview
section.para: A user at a client company can create tasks and assign each task to:

listitem.para: another user in the same company, or
the bank that the company deals with, or
a counterparty - another company that the company deals with

section.para: In adding a company to his or her company's list of counterparties, a client user can arrange for the counterparty to have limited access to , so as to see the tasks assigned to them. This chapter is for a user at such a counterparty. It tells you how to view and reply to tasks.

A task is always associated with some international product, for example an Import Letter of Credit. Typically, a task is a question asked by a client user, who needs information from your company in order to complete the transaction.
As a user at a counterparty, you can:

listitem.para: Mark a task as completed or not.
Post comments about a specific task.
Browse the list of outstanding and completed tasks.

section.title: Task Windows
section.para: Your user interface has three different windows that display lists of tasks. We describe here the different ways they are used. Later sections in this chapter describe their layout in detail.

section.title: Collaboration Window (Tasks)
section.para: When you use any function that initiates a transaction, the form that opens has attached to it a free-floating window entitled Tasks. This is known as the Collaboration Window. It is initially displayed minimized when the form opens. Click the maximize button in its title bar to see it fully.

You use this window to view tasks for the transaction you are viewing. It shows all tasks assigned to your company and attached to this transaction. All users at your company can see this list and choose tasks from it to do.

To reply to a task, you add a comment to it. To do this, click Comments by its entry to display all its existing comments, and then click Post Comment. These comments typically form a conversation between the creator of a task and the person who carries it out.
The client user who created a task can also edit it, so you might find its original text updated at times during this conversation.
You can also create tasks to do yourself. These are called private tasks, and you add them in the lower part of the Collaboraiton Window, headed My Tasks, by clicking Add a task.

Each task has a check box on the left-hand side. This is called the completion check box. The user who carries out the task should click to put a check mark here. Once this is done, the creator can no longer edit the task, but people can still add comments to it.

section.title: Ongoing Tasks
section.para: This list is part of your home page. It lists all tasks that are available for you yourself to do. That is, tasks you've created for yourself to do, tasks that another user in your company has assigned to you, and tasks that a user in your company has marked Public, so that any user in the company can pick the task up and do it.

One column shows the System Id of the transaction that the task is attached to. Clicking this opens the form (like LC Initiation > Retrieve Draft), including the Collaboration Window, for further editing of the transaction.
When another user updates a task, the change appears on your Ongoing Tasks list as soon as you refresh your screen (typically done using F5).
The Ongoing Tasks list does not show comments. Once a task has been marked completed it disappears from this list.

section.title: Tasks Monitoring
section.para: You access this list by clicking Reports on your main menu to display the Message Center menu, and then clicking Tasks Monitoring. This is the fullest list, in that it can show all tasks, both open and completed, and all comments. It has search criteria fields, so you can select which items to show. Note that the Date range fields both default to today's date, so when you first display the list you see only the entries created today.

section.title: Collaboration Window
section.para: This section describes the Collaboration Window in detail.
In the input form for every event of every product, there is a window for managing the tasks associated with the current transaction. Here you can:

listitem.para: update the completion status of a task,
add a new comment to a task.

section.title: Tasks Monitoring
section.para: You access the Tasks Monitoring list from your main menu. It displays a full list of tasks (depending on search criteria).
When you select this option, you are presented with a list of tasks and comments.

You can select which entries are shown, by entering search criteria in the Task Type, Post Date (From and To), System Id, Task Status, and/or Item Type fields. Initially all these fields are blank except that the date fields are set to today's date, so you see all tasks and comments created today.
You can leave the From and/or To fields blank.
You can use wildcards in the System Id field. For example, *5885 will match all system IDs that end in 5885. The comparison is not case sensitive.
If you include comments in the display, only comments attached to tasks of the type and status selected are included.
